description: Weatheria is an artificial sky island that floats on a massive bubble and serves as a weather research and development center. The island is constantly drifting with the wind and is inhabited by elderly weather scientists who study and manipulate meteorological phenomena. The island's technology includes Weather Balls and Wind Knots that can control weather patterns.

keyEvents.title: Nami Arrives on Weatheria
keyEvents.description: Nami wakes up on Weatheria after being sent flying by Bartholomew Kuma. The elderly weather scientists have rescued her and brought her to their floating island.
keyEvents.significance: This marks the beginning of Nami's extended stay on Weatheria, where she will eventually train for two years.

keyEvents.title: Weather Control Demonstration
keyEvents.description: Haredas demonstrates Weatheria's weather control capabilities by making it rain on a drought-stricken island below in exchange for payment.
keyEvents.significance: Showcases the practical applications of Weatheria's weather technology and how the scientists support themselves.

keyEvents.title: Introduction to Weather Balls
keyEvents.description: Haredas introduces Nami to Weather Ball technology, showing how these specialized plants can store clouds and create weather phenomena.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the key technology that will become fundamental to Nami's post-timeskip abilities.

statusHistory.reason: Weatheria continues to drift through the skies

description: Karakuri Island, also known as Future Country Baldimore, is a winter island in Paradise renowned for its advanced technology. It is the birthplace of the genius scientist Dr. Vegapunk. The island features cyborg animals that Vegapunk created as part of an experiment to build an underground heating system for the residents. The island houses Vegapunk's abandoned laboratory containing numerous technological innovations.

keyEvents.title: Franky Arrives on Karakuri Island
keyEvents.description: Franky finds himself on Karakuri Island after being sent flying by Bartholomew Kuma. He is immediately pursued by aggressive cyborg animals.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Karakuri Island as Franky's location during the separation period and introduces the technological wonders he will study.

keyEvents.title: Franky Battles Cyborg Animals
keyEvents.description: Franky fights and defeats several cyborg animals that were chasing him through the forest on Karakuri Island.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the dangerous nature of the island's wildlife and Franky's combat capabilities.

keyEvents.title: Revelation About Vegapunk's Cyborg Experiments
keyEvents.description: It is revealed that Dr. Vegapunk created the cyborg animals to build an underground heating system for the island's residents, the same scientist who modified Bartholomew Kuma.
keyEvents.significance: Expands the lore about Vegapunk's work on Karakuri Island and his innovative but sometimes incomplete projects.

statusHistory.reason: Karakuri Island remains inhabited and active

description: Dr. Vegapunk's abandoned laboratory on Karakuri Island contains numerous technological innovations, blueprints, and experimental devices. The facility has security systems that activate when intruders enter. It houses advanced weapon designs and scientific research that represents some of Vegapunk's early work before he joined the World Government.

keyEvents.title: Franky Discovers Vegapunk's Laboratory
keyEvents.description: Franky stumbles upon Vegapunk's abandoned laboratory with the scientist's name on it. An alarm sounds as he enters the building, indicating active security systems.
keyEvents.significance: This discovery is pivotal for Franky's future development. The technology in this laboratory will enable his massive upgrades during the timeskip. This is also the first concrete appearance of Vegapunk's base of operations.

statusHistory.reason: Laboratory was active when Vegapunk worked there
Vegapunk left the island to work for the World Government, leaving the laboratory behind
